text: Des tonnes de levure Belge et de chêne!!! Lalcool était pratiquement imperceptible tellement cette bière est bien faite. Le Brandy (que je déteste dailleurs) était absent pour mes papilles. Bonne effervescence, belle mousse fine et blanche... Une petite touche citronnée et fermière enrobait le tout avec brio.

A 800. tesztelt sörként erre az italra esett a választásom - némi brandy és az érlelés jelenléte úgy általában igen nagy csalogató erővel bír, a nemes feladat beteljesítésére tökéletes alanynak látszott tehát a főzet. Ezt a meggyőződésemet így utólag sem változtatnám számottevően, minden rendben ment, kellemes benyomásokat hagyott hátra maga után, talán csak arról van szó, hogy minél sötétebb és testesebb egy sör, annál nagyobb eséllyel pályázik kivívni a szimpátiámat. Ebben az esetben azonban nyilvánvalóan szemléletmódot váltottam, így az aranyszínű test tökéletesség-közeli külleme sem kerülte el a figyelmemet. Vibrálóan élénk aromái, melyek a hófehér hab dús rétegei alól bukkannak fel, éretlen zöldalmás, ecetes, almaboros szövevényt alkotva adják a fanyar, üde, spontán erjesztésű ízvilág ígéretét, nem törődve azzal, hogy éppen egy belgian strong ale-t kóstolgatunk. Nem is váratnak sokáig magukra a citromos színezetű, cideres, száraz fehérborok almás kicsengésű legjavát hordozó jegyei, amelyek igen intenzíven, ellentmondást nem tűrően vésik be névjegyüket a kompozícióba. Ki-ki eldöntheti aztán, hogy mennyire belgian strong ale, s mennyire sour ale-szerű a szerkezet, majd kissé materiálisabb irány felé haladva az is megállapodás tárgyát képezheti, hogy mennyire tűnik kimagasló értékűnek a főzet az árához viszonyítva, összességében azonban semmi nem hagy kétséget afelől, hogy a különleges sörök között megérdemelt helye van, így tehát méltó alanyaként szolgálhatott egy kisebbfajta mérföldkő megünnepléséhez.

hazy orange colour, medium sized off-white head; aroma of apple, woody-tannin notes, citruses, bread and slight acetone; taste of oak barrel, tannins, unripe apple, acidic sourness, apple brandy, yeast and hints of acetone; spicy alcohol in the aftertaste; good Belgian strong ale, though definitely not among the best ones; for me, it is clearly not the 14th best Belgian strong ale...anyway, with this, I finally ticked the first 15 :-)
75 cl bottle @ home. Pours cloudy golden amber with a white head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma and flavour are Belgian yeast, apples, lemons, and honey - with a dry finish.

On tap at Owen's Ordinary in North Bethesda, MD. 

Slightly hazy yellow with a fine, off-white head and excellent lacing. 

Aroma of apple jack, white grapes, yeast, candi sugar, brett, oak and banana. 

Taste of sweet white grapes, candi sugar, yeast, sweet apple juice, sour apples, wood, sweet peaches and banana. This very sweet and fruity yet with a slightly sour element, too. 

Full/medium body and low carbonation. 

Great aroma, which initially reminds me of opening a cask of aged apple jack, but then gets more complex--and much sweeter. The flavor continues the complexity, but also the extreme sweetness. I had a 4 ounce pour as a dessert beer, which was perfect. For other purposes, this may be too sweet. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Botella. @La Vache Folle, Burgos 02/03/2017
Color amarillo turbio, pequeña corona de espuma blanca, aromas predominantes son los bretas, con un sabor ligeramente acido, seguido de notas citricas con un final seco, buena cerveza con breat.

UPDATED: FEB 28, 2017 Draft at Khyber Pass. Cloudy golden orange pour with a touch of foam. No lace. Sugary sugarcane malts, citrus hops, and a bit of Brett. Rock candy. Orange saltwater taffy. Duck sauce. Plums. Mango. Faint Belgian florals. Thyme. Rose hips. Hibiscus. Candy floss. Hint of apple cider vinegar. Puckeringly sweet but hides the ABV amazingly well. Flavors separate as it warms. Tart apple at the top. Light brown sugar undernearh. A marvelous confection!
Aroma is funk and oak. Taste us Belgian yeast, oak and some sweetness. Low carbonation, no real head or lacing.

A hazed golden ale with a thin lacing white head. In aroma, sweet fruity malt with light candy sugar, light curacao, light alcohol, nice and smooth. In mouth, a nice sweet fruity malt with light candy sugar, light curacao and coriander, alcohol warmth, light honey and apple, nice and smooth. On tap at Lautre oeil. Earlier Rating: 10/5/2016 Total Score: 3.9A hazed amber ale with a thin white head. In aroma, sweet fruity malt with light Brett, light lactic notes, light woody notes, alcohol warmth, very nice. In mouth, a sweet fruity malt with light coriander, curacao, aniseed, banana esters, bourbon barrel notes, warming alcohol, very nice and complex. On tap at Beaus Oktoberfest 2016.

From Youri. Lightly cloudy golden in color. Initial aroma is apple and barrel, with some heat. Even as it warms, the triple aspect is a little buried, though not totally lost as it is at first. Pleasant apple, Brandy, vanilla and light yeast. Easy drinking despite the abv showing.
Tap at Churchkey. Hazy blonde pour with a white head. Yeasty/Bretty, white wine / grape. Mild Brandy. Fairly strong wood. Somewhat dry finish. Cool beer.

On tap at St. Augustines during 1st 45 taps annual event with Alex and Josh. Pours a slightly hazy gokden with a white head. Aroma is very fruity, cherries, apples. Taste is pretty the same. Moderate to high level of sweetness, moderate level of apple sourness. Very pleasant.

[9/26/16] Draught at Moeder Lambic Original in Brussels. Deep golden with a white head. Aroma of oak, wine, wood, buttery popcorn notes in the back, fruitiness, caramel. Sweetish and slightly tart flavor with caramel, fruits, vanilla, oak, vinous, a bit of alcohol.

Tapped at Bar Hop in Toronto. Super hazy dark golden orange copper color. Maybe the bottom of the keg. Thick soapy head. Great aroma of fresh sour apple juice. Epic taste of malt, caramel, dark fruits, plum marmalade, pears. Warming alcohol, plum/pear/apple fruit and caramel finish. Full body. Light carbonation. Overall epic!

From tap at the original Chez Moeder Lambic. Light hazy yellow golden color with off hite to white head. Light malty, hoppy and yeasty aroma, dusty, light funky, grassy, floral, citrusy fruity, light wood. Sweet, light acidic and bitter tate like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation

13.09.2016, tap @ UNA:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet sour-ish fruity, yeast, candi sugar, minerals, light malts, bubblegum, weeds, alcohol, bark, fruit stones, hay. Taste is slightly sweet mineraly, dried fruits, yeast, minerals, flowers, alcohol, grass, candi sugar, bark, bubblegum, fruit stones, weeds, light malts. Medium bitterness, slightly dry and harsh boozy mouthfeel. Fair enough, not really my cup of tea.

UPDATED: SEP 7, 2016 Murky brown pour, good sized head, considerable lacing. Brandy and spices in the aroma, dark fruit, brett, oak. Sour initially in the taste, brett, dried dark fruit, raisin, plum, brown sugar, brandy, oak, booze. Medium body with minimal carbonation. I remember this being far better.

Apparence : Dorée, moyennement opaque, beau col blanc à la rétention acceptable, effervescence moyenne et modérément rapide, belle dentelle. 
Nez : Pomme, poire, très légers agrumes, juteuse, un peu céréalière, boisée et acide (de la pomme). 
Goût : Pomme, poire, légers agrumes, mi-acide mi-sucrée, légère amertume, malt un peu mielleux. 
Sensation : Effervescence moyenne, corps moyen, belle chaleur dalcool, finale de bonne longueur. 
Bref : Bien différente de sa consur qui nest pas âgée en fut. On a à lorigine une bière très levurée, phénolique et on se retrouve avec un liquide fruité, rustique et légèrement acide, tout en présentant un corps plus atténué certainement dû aux brettanomyces. Le nez est plus intéressant ici, mais jaurais pris le fruité de lun avec le malt et le corps de lautre.

UPDATED: SEP 13, 2016 Une bière aux teints orangés avec peu deffervescence et une bonne carbonatation. La brett domine le nez. En dépit de la brett, on sent également un peu la pomme qui est modérément présente. La bière vieillie 2 ans laisse pratiquement aucune place à la subtilité dans mon souvenir de la Buteuse brassin spécial jeune. La brett est excessivement présente, si bien que lon ne goute presque plus les pommes, ni la buteuse originale. Décevant parce que la bière est définitivement bonne, mais la brett vient tuer la complexité. 

UPDATE - VERSION 2016 - FÛT DE CALVADOS

Calvados

En comparaison avec la version ci-haut, cest beaucoup plus solide. Pommes bien plus présentes. Brett légère. Définitivement à boire fraiche. Bel équilibre pommes - alcool - brett.

Equilibre Magistral !
Blonde grosse carbo et collet persistant.
Aromes complexes de pomme, de bois, de bouquet de fleurs et de bret.
Le mariage Bret et affinage en fut se marient a merveille et quand on rajoute a ca le cote liquoreux avec le brandy de pomme ca devient une tuerie.
Jadore !!!

Tap at Moeder Lambic, 29th June 16. Pours a dark amber, good lacing, aroma is heady barrel, Brett, funk, wood. Taste is rich and complex, but way below the 10 ABV, there is cognac, wood, Brett, liquor, must. The palate is light and slick, minimal carbonation. Very nice
Bottle @ RBBWG 2016. Hazy golden colour, white foam. Sweet nose of brandy and spices. Some vanilla and banana notes. Brett influences. Well balanced. Nice beer.

20/II/16 - 75cl bottle @ RBBWG V (Bens place) - BB: n/a (2016-195) Thanks to JefVerstraete for sharing the bottle!
Clear deep orange beer, small creamy white head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: spicy, cloves, yeast, some banana, sweet, cognac notes. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: yeasty start, bit of brett, sourish, funky, wild yeast? Aftertaste: bitter, spicy, coriander, star anise, funky, hay, brett notes.
Sampled at RBWG16. Thnx for sharing, everybody ! Pours clear , dark blonde. Small white head. Smell is bitter, grainy, malty. Taste is sharp, bitter, aromatic, bit spiced.

Bottle sample @ RBBWG 2016, thanks Eric.
Ambrée-cuivrée trouble, col fin beige.
Arôme met en avant un bouquet brett, le profil Brandy reste plus secondaire avec un léger accompagnement fruits/baies des bois.
Palais met de suite en avant le côté alcool, le tout garde une certaine dose aigrelette, de brett? houblonné modéré ajoutant une touche damertume avec une levure persistante en fin de bouche avec une rondeur fruité baies. Brandy ajoute un subtil côté de barrique qui nest pas désagréable mais renforce la nation de chaleur en bouche. Belge de caractère.

0.75 l bottle at RBBWG 2016 in Antwerpen. Minimally hazy, pale golden amber with a white head. Sweetish-sourish, slightly fruity aroma of white grapes, gooseberry, oak and lemon. Sweetish, slightly sourish taste of honey, white grapes, gooseberry and oak, followed by a short, moderately tart finish. Thin to medium body, slightly creamy and spritzy mouthfeel. Nice!

Thank you for sharing jefverstraete! 750 ml. bottle sampled @ RBBWG V. Hazy golden, creamy white. Nose is lightly butter with lots of sweet grains, sugar, malts, sugary thick malts, low plastic. Taste is fizzy esters, honey, candy dough, sugar, sweet warming, touch boozy, oxidized, honey, warming, caramel, solid. Quite boozy, sugary & malty body. Very monolithic, could use more complexity. Good though but not exceptional, decent Belgian.
Bottle at RBBWG, thanks for sharing ericdkok. Light alcohol, fruity liquor notes, not bad.
Mostly headless, dark golden. Honey, clove, vanilla, apricot. Somewhat foamy, light bitter, but spicy sharp. Complex without being heavy. Good brew! Thanks! (Sampled during RBBWG 2016)

Aroma is clove , passion fruit ,tart and light yeast. Taste is honey, caramel and citrus. Very well balanced with some funk and tartiness. Very well balanced. Appearance is a cloudy orange with a thin pearl head that retains fairly well.

Dorée/orangée, trouble, avec un bon col de mousse crème. Nez acidulé, de pommes, de cuir et dabricots confits. Goût citronné, fruité, de pommes, de cuir, sucré, dabricots et dalcool. Cest un bombe en bouche, toutes les flaveurs arrivent en même temps et il faut être attentif pour bien décortiquer le tout. Il sagit dun délicieux nectar!

Bottle share on the 42nd floor, thanks to Kenny. 10%. Hazy orange, still, small foamy white head, light lacing. Aroma is orange, dirty and earthy, dried flowers. Body is medium, smooth, soft carbonation. Taste is sweet sugars, tangerine, cararmel, a little sour with a dry finish. Quite nice - sweet with a subtle sourness.

8th October 201542nd Floor Tasting. Hazy gold beer, small pale cream colour head. Palate is light and semi dry, decent fine carbonation. Light malts, mild creamy sweetness. Little apple sweetness, generic fruits well buried underneath. Some brandy spice. Light finish. Hangs together very well indeed. Nicely balanced and integrated and dangerously drinkable.

Bottle split at the 42nd floor Tasting, thanks to Kenny, 08/10/15.
Orange amber with a decent beige covering. 
Nose is juicy fruit, orange, apricot jam, light spice, Belgian yeast esters, caramel. 
Taste comprises toffee, light wood, spice, Xmas cake, soft barrel, caramel. 
Full bodied, fine carbonation, nice boost at the curtain call. 
Solid stuff, great balance, good use of the barrel.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle at the sky high Canary wharf tasting. Hazed hazed golden orange coloured pour with a thin off white head. Aroma is vanilla oak, cream, pear drops, jammy fruits. Flavour is nice custard, orange peel, orange, Little wood and green apple. Pear drops. Palate is medium, strawberry fruit. Palate is medium sweet, moderate carbonation. Nice subtle Belgian yeast.

Bottle thanks to Mr Kenny. Consumed at the 42nd floor tasting. It pours hazy deep gold with a small white head. The nose is rich, toasty, earthy, wood, red apple, sherbet, funk, sherbet and some must. The taste is crisp, bitter, some spice, earth, straw, stewed apple, sherbet, lemon rind, marmalade, lick of acidity and some warming alcohol action through the finish. Medium - full body and moderate carbonation. A bit hot perhaps, but enjoyable overall.

75cl bottle at the 42nd level tasting, London. It pours a hazy golden color with a small white head. Aroma is funky and sweet with fruits and white wine. Taste is tangy sweet boozy with citrus tangerine and funk. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. Overall, awsome

Bottle shared in London - huge thanks to Kenny for this treat. Pours unclear gold with a frothy white head. Tangy, jammy citrus fruits in the nose, pale wood, lemon, tangerine. Medium to heavy sweet flavor, rich honey, tangy orange, tangerine, mild oaky dryness. Full bodied with fine carbonation and oily texture. Warming finish, lots of jammy citrus, marmalade, tangy citrus, slight woody dryness, bready pale malts. Tasty stuff.

Triple based beer, aged 8months in apple brandy barrels. Dry. Mittlelfrue, cascade and tettnanger hops are used but they do not cover the malty traditional aroma of triple beer. Brettanomyces are used.

Edition 2015. Gushing volcanique à louverture. Robe jaune ambrée trouble surmontée dun généreux col de mousse qui sestompe rapidement. Dentelle glissante et huileuse. Arômes de pommes, citron, bretts, chêne, cuir, abricot. Un peu de lime et banane. En bouche, saveurs intenses de pommes vertes fermentées, bois humide, pain, zeste de citron. De fortes effluves dalcool envahissent le palais et procurent une belle chaleur. On discerne également en finale du cuir, quelques esters fruités comme labricot et lorange. Lamertume est plutôt modérée. Je nai pas perçu par contre la torréfaction indiquée sur la description. Texture bien ronde, effervescence à point. La lourdeur de la tripel mélangé au côté sauvage que procure le vieillissement en barrique forme un produit équilibré plein de saveurs. Un des meilleurs produits du TTD.

Toujours , jusquà maintenant, ma bière préféré. Forte, ronde, sucré sans accès avec des relants de brandy, de pomme mure, de pomme verte et de forpet de connifère. Un vrai plaisir à deguster et à voir évoluer.

Bouteille - 750ml. Belle robe dorée, voilée et coiffée dun col de mousse blanche bien dense. Puissant arôme malté/houblonné assorti deffluves de pommes, de bois, de bananes et de brettanomyces. Lalcool est bien dissimulé. En bouche, cest puissant, complexe mais aussi très bien équilibré. Les saveurs maltées et houblonnées saccompagnent de nuances de bois, de pommes, de raisins verts, deau de vie et de lie. Cette belle expérience se conclut sur une finale longue, costaude, réconfortante et modérément sûre. Magnifique!

Bottle shared by Duffman, RBSG 
Cloudy dark golden with a medium sized off-white head, good lacing. Aroma of toasted malts and woody. Taste is woody, tart and apples  
Good

Bottle shared by Duffman. Thanks!

A: Red color, firm white head, 

N: Toffee, apple brandy, touch of lemon rind, orange syrup, oak, lavender, peppercorn, grass, straw, biscuit.

T: Quite sweet - not cloying, no bitterness.

M: Medium body, light alcohol, creamy carbonation.

O: Very tasty. Good balance - the apple brandy is well-integrated. Much appreciate the opportunity to give this one a whirl.

Outstanding. Cellared from 2010 or 2011. Pours a bright copper and orange in the body with a thin, dense head of ivory white. The aroma is amazing, toned down brett, light orange peel and lemon peel, esters, floral and spicy notes with coriander and a bit of black pepper. Zesty and rich with apple and barrel notes blended well in the profile. Delectable first sip with sweet apple notes, orange peel, coriander, light toasted malts, caramel, grassy and floral notes. A sweet cidery esque flavour persists with light woody and barrel notes soft and subtle. Nicely rounded out with a bit of bitterness. Tons of esters and beautiful apple/barrel notes. Fantastic brew. Brett is subdued after cellaring.
Sample from 750 ml bottle. Deep golden to orange colour, white head. Aroma of apricots, basement, mild spices and dust. Medium sweet and oaky and spicy flavour, hints of apple brandy. Good beer.

Blond/Ambré. Fin collet blanc. Belle effervescence. Levure sauvage. Brett. Léger piquant. Belle amertume. Très fruité. Vin blanc sec. Raisin. Pêche. Abricot. Houblon florale. Épicé. Boisé. Pomme. Bien complexe. Finale sèche et astringente. J'aime beaucoup.

Bottle @ WWT IV, small sample. Slight hazy golden color, short head. Aroma of brett, slight apple, bit spicy, hint of vanilla, touch of funk. Soft sweet taste, bit dry as well. Orval on steroids with a hint of barrel. Like it.

Bottle @ WWT IV, courtesy of caesar, thnx to JulienHuxley. Pours a hazy amberish beer with a small white head on top. Aroma of Belgian yeast , white fruits, light oaky notes. Flavor is a bit boozy, slightly brandy. Overall the yeast is a bit strong in this one. A bit overrated maybe, but still quite ok to be honest.

Bottle at WWT tasting. Slight hazy golden with nice white head. Lots of Brett on the nose. Yoghurt, hay, very funky, light nuts, pineapple, cider-like notes, quite herbal too towards the finish. Very light sweet with a nice light tartness throughout. Medium bodied. Has a lot of Orval similarities, but with some rougher edges. Very nice.

Bottle shared at WWT IV thanks to JulienHuxley who is no longer with us. Pours hazy dark golden with a ring off white head. Aroma of Brett funk, oak, Brandy, fruits, apricot and caramel. Flavour is over moderate sweet and light to moderate bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Sample at WWT IV courtesy of Julienhuxley.
Thin white head. Hazy golden pour. Well hidden alcohol. Nice brandy notes. Very good

Bottle @ WWT IV shared by Caesar thanks to JulienHuxley. Clear golden color, average to medium sized white head that leaves fair to good lacing. Smell and taste lightly malts, some wood, brett, lightly alcohol, a hint of herbs and spices. Medium body and carbonation.

Bottle - thanks kbudd! Pours crystal clear orange, small white head, dissipates fairly quickly, some lacing. Aroma is pretty, dusty, caramel, a bit of brandy, oak tannin. Flavor is medium sweet, light tart, medium funky, horse blanket, green apple, a touch of acetone, caramel malt, oak tannins. Medium body, Pretty good.

Clear light copper with a tiny head. Barnyard, apple brandy, honey sweetness, spicy. Very, very well balanced, a little sweet, not much bitterness. Full body, slick but very smooth, highly drinkable. A masterpiece

Grâce à trois levures différentes, vieillie quatre mois en fût de chêne américain ayant hébergé le brandy de pomme de la cidrerie Michel Jodoin, nous avons la Buteuse Brassin Spécial...( juste le nom me fait baver). Au nez , cest définitif la Brett fait parti de ce savant mélange de levures. Par la suite des arômes de tabac frais , vanille , épices , torréfication et de fruits caramelisés sy ajoutent. La bouche propose les mêmes saveurs suivie de la pêche, labricot et dune finale animal(Brett) et de boisé. PROOST Trou du diable vous avez fait de cette bière , ma bière préférée de tous les temps !!! Sur ce jen veux dautres !
This is a pretty special beer, a great example of the style. This is very smooth and dangerously drinkable for such a monster.

750ml bottle pours a pale orange color without much head. Thick consistency. Such an amalgam of flavor. Nice mild oak from start to finish. Some peppery spice. A little Brandy liquor. Great brett flavors too.

Pour out of 750 mL bottle, slight gush out of bottle, hazy reddish pour with white head, aroma brought tart fruit, oak, some red fruit, touch of brandy and oaky notes, lots of caramel, toffee, hints of apples into a bit of nice caramelized sugars. Taste is a mix of nice oak, caramel, toffee, candied dark fruit into some plum, apples, some red fruit into a funky tart note, touch of oak and sweet brandy into hints of earth, finishing tart, sweet. A bit messy, but nice flavors in there.

Embouteillée en septembre 2014, violent «gushing» à louverture de la bouteille, ce nest pas la première fois avec un «Brassin Spécial» de Trou du Diable Bière jaune-orangée, remplie de particules en suspension, effervescence moyenne-bonne, surmontée dun col blanc pas tellement large, moyennement dense, mais bien persistant. Arômes de pain frais, malt mielleux, boisé, et levure sauvage légèrement vinaigrée. Beaucoup deffluves fruités également, principalement des fruits du verger (pêche, pomme verte), mais aussi des petits fruits (framboise) et du raisin vert. On note également de subtiles odeurs dun houblon floral et résineux et de quelques épices (poivre, clou de girofle, coriandre). Nez fort intéressant, très intense, complexité élevée. En bouche, pétillement moyen sur la langue, onctuosité intéressante au palais, cest moelleux et velouté. Au goût, pain frais, léger malt mielleux, léger boisé, acidité liée au vieillissement en fût qui est dominante, cest à la fois vinaigré et citronné, présence de ce goût typique de animal/cuir de la levure sauvage. Beaucoup de fruité en bouche également, pêche, pomme verte, raisin vert, citron Le houblon (floral et résineux) et lalcool ne sont que subtilement perceptible derrière cette acidité dominante, lamertume est minimale. Très bonne bière, goût intéressant, très intense, bonne complexité en bouche, mais je préfère tout de même la Buteuse régulière, je trouve ce brassin spécial un peu trop acide.

Bière dexception, du gros calibre du Trou du diable. Le vieillissement en fût de brandy aux pommes de Michel Jodoin change complétement la bière. Vanille, pommes, beaucoup de pommes sucrées, abricot. On sent bien le 10% dalcool. Un des joyaux de TDD, une bière qui vaut le détour même à 20$ dans les magasins spécialisés ou 25$ au pub directement.

UPDATED: MAR 6, 2015 Update: 2nd bottle drank on March 6. Thanks Seb for the wonderful gift :)  750ml bottle bought from Halles St-Jean. Aroma: Amazing aroma of wood, peaches, apricot, apples, vanilla. App: clear copper with small white head. Taste and Palate: full body, sweet with slight acidity, funky and dry finish, average carbonation. Overall: Wow. This really is a pimp version of the original Buteuse. It adds lots of Apple and Apricot in the aroma and lots of funkiness in the taste and palate. An amazing beer from TDD, probably one of my favorite beer of all time so far.

(Bottle, Stockholm Beer Festival, 27 Sep 2014) Deep golden colour with brief, white head. Fruity, hoppy nose with dried fruit, apricots and vinous hints of sweet white wine (Muscat grapes?). Malty, fruity taste with notes of dried fruit, pineapple, apricots, honey and a warming touch of apple brandy in the finish. Full body, quite sweet, with fairly low bitterness. Complex, warming and quite tasty. Very nice.

750ml bottle shared @EurHop (Rome). Pours hazy golden color with a medium white foam. Aroma is belgian yeasts, brett, some acidic notes, some fruits. Flavour is medium sweet with lot of complexity, but a bit chaotic. Medium to high body, low carbonation. Interesting.

Bière doccasion, bière rare et ça va devenir une tradition, en espérant que mon Marchand de bière en aura à chaque année. Au nez et aux yeux cest juste correcte, orangé, trouble et avec un dentelle, arôme persistant de levure belge difficile à replacer, mais attirant. Et cest en bouche que ça se passe. Dabord je pense à la brettamomyce et au cidre de pomme. Ensuite, jen ai aucune idée, cest mystérieux et puissant. Complexe et équilibré. Je vais continuer à la démystifier. Je suis heureux de mon achat. À boire!

Dégustée en accompagnement dun steak dEspadon au sésame et arrosé dun filet de citron. Attention aux amateurs de bières boisées, celle-ci est diaboliquement bonne! Jen suis à ma troisième bouteille et chacune a explosée - à déboucher au-dessus de lévier! Au passage de la bouteille au verre, le liquide laisse échapper des arômes de chêne, de moût de pomme, de résine, de vieux grenier... La mousse formée de grosses bulles est dun blanc maculé et abondant annonçant une effervescence toute aussi généreuse. Au rythme de la musique créée par le crépitement des bulles éclatant à la surface de ce collet-monté, de douces et chaudes effluves dalcool, de feuilles mortes, de bois pourri et de pommes envahissent à la fois lappareil olfactif et gustatif tellement les arômes sont complexes. Le palas est le côté que jai le moins apprécié avec sa texture huileuse et son effervescence un brin piquante, mais comprenons-nous, lexpérience du palais demeure fantastique tant le tout est cohérent et bien ficelé. Au sujet du goût, je nai rien à ajouter qui na pas déjà été mentionné. Jajouterais toutefois que cette bière vaut son fort prix et quelle peut facilement substituer une bonne bouteille de blanc si on recherche à accompagner un repas dune boisson complexe et équilibrée où fraîcheur et caractère se conjuguent parfaitement. Attention cependant à ne pas tuer la saveur des aliments car cette bière ne fera pas de compromis!

750 ml bottle. Pours a deep copper color with moderate foamy retentive head. Aromas of candied peach/apricots, rubber, brett, oak, green bananas. and toasted malts. Flavors of funky brett, stoned fruit, old oak, and dry malts. Impressive.
Arôme de pomme très présent. Entrée en bouche épicée avec des notes de levure belge. Succulente!

Belle couleur dor.e avec un col blanc assez résistant. En bouche cest définitivement un chef doeuvre lune des meilleures bières de cette micro et au Québec. Fruits jaunes,Brett,Bois,Brandy,caramel, le tout est très bien balancé et le % dalcool est très bien caché!

Olfactif: Les bretts sautent au nez avec des arômes de pommes et de cuir. Assez surette comme olfactif. 
Visuel: Ambré / orangé, la mousse est très stable
Gustatif: Des notes de réglisse, de fruits des champs, de pommes, de caramel, de vanille, de brandy, le tout suivi dun petit houblonnage herbacé qui vient couronné le tout. Dune complexité remarquable. La texture est légèrement rondelette et léquilibre des saveurs acides, sucrées et fruitées est très juste. Une bière remarquable.

UPDATED: NOV 8, 2014 Je ne sais pas exactement où commencer pour décrire cette bière. Cest une des bières les plus complexes que jai bues. Au nez, cest comme inspirer quelque chose de quasi-solide tellement cest dense. La pomme sucrée et les bretts sont les éléments sexprimant le plus au travers ce mur dodeurs. En bouche, cest définitivement "in your face", aucune concession : ça attaque toute cellule sensorielle existante dans la bouche. Cest une bière difficile à comprendre, à cerner... Il faut plus quune bouteille avant de se faire une idée. Elle est dotée dune complexité folle exprimée sur un corps et une carbonation absolument exemplaires. Le 10% ABV est indicernable mais participe définitivement à la magie.

(Bottle during Zwanze Day/Funk Night @ barVolo, Sept 20 2014) Pours clear dark orange, moderate white head with lace. Aroma has ice wine, brandy, caramel apple, wood and a bit of smoky Brett. Light acid undertone. Palate sweet at first, candied apple, caramel, red fruit, bit woody. Spirit character builds in finish as it dries, wood notes, alcohol heat, lingering herbal quality. Medium body with sharp carb. On the sweetish side despite the Brett, which contributes a nice light smoky funk. The apple brandy and wood blend with and elevate the base tripel. Really warming sipper, balanced with lots going on. A nice change tasted on a night of sour beers, but would be very nice on its own. Top beer from TDD.

Sample at SBWF 2014. 

Hazy golden/orange with a white head. Nice aroma and taste of brandy, apples, sweet malt, some brett and oak. Warming alcohol in the finish. A nice one to sip.
Pours copper color with minimal head. Aroma is wet oak, spoiled Apple, sweet caramel, lactic funk. Taste is very sweet and loaded with wet cardboard and pretty tart. Not great.

At Eurhop festival in Rome-Italy. Pours clear golden, tick little white head. Nose has sourness, green apple juice. Mouth is in style: a bit too sweet but good. Apple still in the mouth. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2014 Nez acide, de brandy aux pommes, de sucre et de grains. Le goût est terriblement bien balancé entre acidité, alcool et arômes fins. La finale picote la langue et on en redemande a coup sûr. Un autre bijou de Trou du Diable!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
750ml bottle. Wow, what an interesting combo, spices, heavy brandy character, and a bit of tartness.

750 ml bottle. Hazy amber colour with a medium, frothy, long lasting white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, overripe fruit, yeast and alcohol. Flavour is sweet with malt, fruit, yeast and alcohol leading to a dry, bitter finish. Medium body, oily texture and soft carbonation.

Un joli liquide couleur pêche se laisse dominer par une mousse plus ou moins généreuse, mais qui sacharne à rester. Des arômes à la fois fruités et funky émanent du verre, particulièrement un "parfum" de pommes confites et de cuir. Un goût prononcé de marmelade dabricots, rehaussé par une chaleur alcoolisée qui enveloppe le palais. Une belle petite acidité très légère vient picoter la langue, la finale est, tant quà elle, un peu boisée et très sucrée. Quelle magnifique complexité, une des meilleures bières que jai eu lhonneur de boire.

750ml bottle. Clear amber liquid with effervescent bubbles and a frothy white head. Funky, leathery, barnyardy, wild yeast aromas right up front with a nice oakiness to it. Taste is caramel apples soaked in brandy paired with pears, apricot and orange zest. A nice fruity and honeyed sweetness, which is not unlike ice cider, blends with the vanilla and spices. Palate wise, pleasant alcohol warmth, soft carbonation and full body contribute to its liquorous texture. Delicious stuff.

Bottle shared by alexsdad06. Poured clear golden color with an average frothy white head that was mostly lasting with good lacing. Moderate herbal, yeast and green apple aroma. Medium to abundant body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium complex yeast bittersweet flavor with a medium to heavy bittersweet finish of moderate to long duration. My expectations where met with an above average for style brew.

750 ml bottle shared with Tmoney99 and the group if they show. Pours a clear golden color with a medium sized white head after foaming out of the bottle (Im going to stop opening these damn things). The aroma and flavor have sweet malts, green apple, Brett, some alcohol with a big dose of wood. Tasty stuff. Thanks to kbudd19 for the bottle.

750ml bottle, shared at Tmoney99s 10K tasting. Hazy orange color. Little white head. Couple loose bits of lace. Medium to bigger body. Lighter carbonation, very dry texture. Very spicy bite to this. Kind of sweet, with some alcohol burn. Some orange, citrus, acidic aromas. belgian yeast. Interesting, but not crazy about this one. Longer kind of citric brandy barrel taste. Grows on me as it goes. Good long aftertaste.

750 ml bottle to taster (shared by alexsdad06). Looks semi-transparent orange with eggshell head that steadily dissipates into lacing. Smells tart and oaky with notes of cider. Tastes like it smells with a nice, dry mouthfeel. Good beer!

750 mL bottle at a Trou du Diable barrel-aged tasting at Volo, served in a stem glass. Pours clear orange with a few bubbles but no head. The nose has notes of sweet caramel malts, brown sugar, toasted oak and subtle tripel spice. The flavour is moderately sweet with caramel, brown sugar, oak barrel, Belgian spice. The finish is long and malty with Belgian spice along with subtle apple notes. On the palate, medium in body with a smooth milky texture and minimal carbonation. Overall a great barrel aged Belgian-style ale. Delicious. 2013-05-25

Bottle thanks to my Canadian friend Mark, who muled some Surly north of the border and returned with this beauty. Bottle gushed just a bit when opened. Hazy dark amber pour with a white head. Stone fruit nose with some funk. This is a real boozer in the taste, with a nice heat in the aftertaste. Full mouthfeel, slightly sweet malty that moves into a plethora of fruits, straw and finishing just a bit bitter with a nice heat. Really nice.

Darkish yellow with a pale head. Aroma is brett, pear, apricot, dried fruits. Medium bodied, sweet and sour on the palate, great balance. Taste is citrus peel, dried peach, dried pear, apricot. Much nicer than the regular version.

750 ml bottle. Pours a clear golden with a resilient white head. Aroma is pear, tartness, yeast, vanilla cake. Flavor is woody, apple, brandy, butter candy, wild fruit, lemon, orange, pear, mint. Finish is lemon, lime, citrus, peels, vanilla, peach, apricot. Lingering spices and mints. Light to medium body, soft mouthfeel, average carbonation. Pretty much a masterpiece.

Quite the beer, but I think I prefer the regular. The barrel certainly changes this. Nice apple finish. Pours orange clear without much head or lacing. Barrel is very prominent and dominates aroma. A little boozy as well. Some sweet malt as well and light perfume. Bottle at Volo for Zwanze Day.
UPDATED: JUL 18, 2014 La Buteuse est déjà exceptionnelle, mais alors ce brassin spécial... Un pur chef doeuvre.

de couleur orange ambre tout de suite en versant cette biere on a des arome de pomme avec un cote vanillé et en bouche c est tout simplement sublime le melange de la pomme et de la vanile avec un cote de caramel brule c est un parfait equlibre (rate 81)

Un petit quelque chose de spécial pour mon 300e rating! Bouteille 750ml. Couleur orangée translucide, mousse blanche dense laissant une belle dentelle. Arôme de vanille, pomme, brett, alcool léger, boisé. Goût de pomme, alcool, légère acidité, légère amertume en fin de bouche, boisé en arrière-goût. Carbonation faible, corps moyen-dense.

UPDATED: JUL 30, 2013 Bottle - The apples come through with the barrels and the typical brett smells.  Cloudy orange with a good white head.  Apple, apricot, oak, brett and some grape.  Acidity and a bit of burn.  An interesting beer but not as good as some of their others I have had the pleasure to try.
Bottle at RBJG#2 - Grand Tasting Tims Place. Clear yellow - white head. Lacto notes, lovely fruity, brandy, wheaty, light light bretty, tropical fruits, citrus, kalk, dryness, lovely.

Pours a nice clear orange/golden with a thin bright white head. Aroma is on the sweeter side but with a nice hint of the brett with some leather notes and some fruits. Taste is definitely sweet but the brett did its job pretty well as it ends up not cloying and pushing a bit toward dryness (let this one age a little more). Flavors are fruity and funky, displayed in a well behaved manner. This one is always a winner from TDD, coming a close second to their Dulcis Succubus for me.

This had more sweetness to counteract the dry sourness of the previous Le Trou I had. A bit more length and breadth to it too. A sweet well made tripel, well balanced funk. Guess you could say funk and monk. Or big, less hoppy orval. Either way.

Bottle at Tims RPJG#2. Pours a clear golden with a small white head. Sweet with some bretty aromas. Some residual sugars. Also some aromas of plums.  Full bodied. Medium to soft carbonation. Dry and bretty finish.

Pours a surprisingly clear (though still hazy) yellow-orange with just a bit of white head. Smell is sweet caramel, oak, funk, and citrus. Palate is medium bodied with slightly lacking carbonation. Taste is peaches, apricots, caramel, just fantastic! If you ever get a chance to have some of this, definitely go for it.

RBJG2. Light golden colour, small white head.  Aroma is funky, sour cream, white pepper. Taste is nice sweet, caramel, hint of booze. Easy drinking.  Boozy finish. Toffee. Pretty nice and quite different. I am very much into these trou de diable beers.
Bottle at RBJG 2 Grand Tasting, thanks MartinT. Amber colour with a white head. Some lacing. Mild sour spicy aroma. Strong flavour, fruity, slightly sour, spicy orange.
Bottled. Orange-gold, clear, with lace. Nose of hops, grass, lemon, cream, yogurt. Sweet malt flavor, fruity, tangy, yogurt, vanilla, apples. Quite nice, good barrel quality.

Dark amber color. Creamy white head. Nose is full of spices, cardamon, grains of paradise and orange peel, while the brandy notes are really turned down. However,  in the mouth brandy is the first thing that hits your tongue. The beer is very dry and boozy. Hoppy for the style, lots of spices and orange notes going on, but more in the background. Very well balanced. Very well executed. Highly enjoyable.

Belle couleur blonde légèrement trouble, odeurs qui promettent un côté acidulé, légèrement épaisse et plutôt puissante. Le fruité prend le dessus, tout en laissant la subtile arôme boisée du fût remonter en fin de bouche. On a de la difficulté à soupçonner le brandy, mais il se trouve bel et bien dans la palette fruitée qui détonne dès le départ. Une bière très intéressante, unique même, mais son prix élevé la laisse malheureusement un peu hors de portée. Ne boudons cependant pas notre plaisir.
Bottle shared by marcus. Taste is slight sour with a belgium yeast. Color is yellow with white head.

Bottle shared by Marcus. Pours light orange gold with a fizzy foamy beige head. Aroma reminds of calvados. Maybe with a hint of citrus. Near full bodied. Flavor is apple, oak and wood. Dry. Decently bitter. Very tasty.

Bottle from City Beer. Pours orange amber with a modest beige head and an apple aroma. There is a caramel malt and apple flavor with a subtle brandy finish. This is a well-crafted brew that is a pleasure to drink. Quite complex in that is blends malt, cider and brandy characteristics seamlessly.

Jai bu cette fameuse Buteuse Brassin Spécial dans plusieurs circonstances et cétait toujours un plaisir difficile à calculer. Quand je dis «fameuse», le mot est faible. Jai vu des gens sarracher les cheveux pour cette bière (pour en avoir et pour tenter den saisir la complexité). Mais quand je tente den décrire les saveurs, je men remets toujours à létiquette qui, à mon avis, réussis admirablement bien à nous faire saisir lessence du produit : «Cette bière exceptionnelle, fermentée grâce à trois levures différentes, a vieilli quatre mois en fût de chêne américain ayant hébergé le brandy de pomme de la cidrerie Michel Jodoin. Elle présente un côté vanillé, épicé, torréfié et animal. Sy mélange aux effluves dalcool chaud le caramel brûlé, la pêche, labricot et le tabac frais...» La bouteille que jai bu ce soir avait 15 mois et a admirablement tenu la route. La madérisation commence à être perceptible, mais ça ne fait quajouter à lénigme de la Buteuse. Sérieusement... mais vraiment... le Trou du Diable nous a brassé une grande bière!
Bouteille au mondial de la bière de Mtl, robe blonde orangée, arôme de levure et de pomme, goût de fruits séchés et de levure belge.

Bottle at Bellwoods, TorontoHazy amber color, medium sized head. The aroma is woody, with some apple cider, and light sourness. Good body strength; malt flavor, quite sweet, with a nice combination of wood and fruit; a light vinous touch too; in the final there is a light astringency and tartness.Complex. Very good.

UPDATED: APR 25, 2014 Bouteille 750 ml. 10%. FINALEMENT !. Couleur jaune ambrée, mousse blanche-beige. Arôme de Brett, chêne, malt. En bouche, malt, acide, chêne, pommes. Finale légèrement amère. Brett ? je sais pas si cest moi mais ce goût est bizarre un peu.

Bière orangée et voilée, accompagnée de minuscules particules en suspension, ayant une mousse typique. Le nez est rempli dodeurs diverses. Les brettanomyces sont les plus évidents. Les fleurs sauvages, la levure ainsi que lalcool sensuivent. Au travers ça, des arômes de fruits exotiques et de pommes vertes nous titillent les narines. La bouche est un peu surprise de son goût. Les bretts prennent ici toute la place. Un côté acidulé reste longtemps sur certaines parties de la langue, tandis que lalcool camoufle trop certaines particularités, ce qui les rend difficilement identifiables. 

En faisant la lecture du descriptif sur létiquette, on se demande sils nont pas abusé dimagination pour la vendre, à un prix exorbitant, soit dit en passant. Cela peut-être simplement une question de perception, mais il ny aucune trace de vanille, quelque chose paraît épicé, mais cest vague. Lhistoire du tabac frais, cest tiré par le chveux. Le poête de létiquette devait alterner entre une cigarette au bec, pas allumée et pour parler du côté animal, un jerky de buf.

Cest sans aucun doute une bière à part, on sentend là-dessus. 
(342-090912)

750 ml bottle from Peluso, enjoyed with a meal. Nice apple flavours, fruity, fresh, the alcool is not to present. As the beer became warmer, caramel tones became more present and alcool also. At 20$ a bottle this had serious potential to disappoint but it did not. I would buy again. A special beer.

Bottle 750 ml. Bought at Peluso (Montreal). Served in Trappist glass. Pours cloudy amber with medium white head. Nice lacing. Aroma: amazing! Citrus, oak, apple acidity, fruits. Taste: amazing as well! malt, spices, peaches, abricots, yeast, hops, oak, apple acidity. Good bitter finish. Balance is near perfect. Full bodied. Truly awesome beer.
Bottle sampled at THE FESTIVAL with Andrew. Pours a deep body. Aroma is dark fruit, apple, oak and brandy. Mouthfeel is lively and medium with notes of brandy, belgian yeast, oak and apple.

From Savvy!  Pours a hazy orange-yellow color with an off-white head.  Aroma has some apple, wood, and some bretty notes?  Taste is sweet with apple flavors.  Medium bodied and oily.  For some reason this one didnt live up to my expectations.  I think perhaps the brett didnt work for me.
Pours orange with some head and lacing. Sour with some brandy and cereal. Lovely beer.

Bottle thanks to Savvy1982!  Clear dark yellow pour, a little lasting head and a slightly sweet pear and funky aroma.  Flavor was also slightly sweet pear, apples, nice malty balance and finished with a hint of funk.  Very nice, I wouldnt mind getting my hands on another bottle of this.

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2012 April 02-2012 - Bottle 750 ml. Appearance: Pours hazy golden with a small fully diminishing white head. Aroma: Tons of fruits. Brett, acidity, apple. Taste: Fruits (mostly apple), brett, alcohol. Overall: A combination of that much fruits, with brett and apple brandy barrel aging make this one a very unique beer. Again, a great product from Trou du Diable.  
9-3-9-3-17 = 4.1

Bottle (750 ml) 2010 (tasted on november 17, 2012): almost the same description but the brett has taken a lot more place and I think this one is near his peak right now. Awesome beer! 9-4-9-4-18 = 4.4

Bottle at Volo with thanks to HogTownHarry. Appearance: Vibrant golden orange, small snow white head. Aroma: wild, a little orange, slight Orval like notes, a little yeast, citrus peel & spice. Flavour: Funky, tangy orange,  brandy, marmalade, again, lots of Orval notes, tremendous yeast, wood and sour finish. Just lovely.

Lovely pale gold with a soft light head. Scents of cinnamon, nutmeg, cranberries, brandy. A crisp, tart, mildly sour sensation on the palate. Finishes with a slight ginger ale aspect along with peach, apricot and honey.

750 mil - A really lovely beer I hope I see again to buy on site.  Orange clear beer in a wine glass.  A thin head quickly dissipates.  Smells of brett and ripe oranges. Taste is medium sweet and mildly bitter and apple or pear rhubarb crisp with citrus.   Mouthfeel is oily but ends with an astringency

Bottle 750 ml. 2011. 

Pours hazy amber. White head, fully diminishing. Ligth carbonatation. Smells of small fruits, and a little acidic. Apples? Tastes small fruits, really interesting combination of fruits, very well balenced bitterness. Explosion of fruits in the mouth. Special taste, kinda mysterious. Is it caused by the use of 3 kind of yeast, or use of apple brandy barrels? Hides very well its alchool. A very good beer.

750ml bottle pours a pale amber color with a huge white head that lasts a while and eventually settles to some thin lacing on the glass.  Aroma is light fruits with some caramel malts and yeast with a bit of oak.  Taste is light fruitiness with some caramel malts and yeast with a bold herbal hoppy bitterness and oak in the finish.  Medium to heavy body with adequate carbonation leaving a nice touch on the palate.  A very well done brew for this style, recommended for others to give this one a try.

Bouteille 750ml. Belle couleur doree opaque avec un beau collet de mousse.      Nez de levure et de cidre. Soyeux en bouche, belle amertume balancee par le gout de levure et de brandy. On ne goute pas du tout lalcool. Dommage quelle soit introuvable car jen acheterais a la caisse.

750ml brown bottle. Golden in colour, some haze and sediment. Thin whitish head, no lace. Nose has bright cider apples ,some tartness and notes of brett. In the mouth the beer has caramel and sweetish apple notes, finishes with some mild booze, super mouth drying wood character, lingering brett. Tongue prickling carbonation, body is medium. Lovely beer, would have no problem drinking this one at any time. Even after the Ikea snifter i was drinking it from imploded in my grasp and scissored two 1cm cuts into the flesh of my left hand which innocently held this amazing elxlir. Blood flowed. I bleed for good beer, and would bleed again for another bottle of this.

750 mL bottle from Secret Santa JulienHuxley. Must be 2009, as its the 750 format. I had this a couple years back and really liked it but somehow never got the rating, so Im glad to have it tonight. Pours a hazy amber color with a medium sized frothy off-white head. Decent head retention. Aroma of yeast, honey, apples, wood, spice, vanilla. The taste is caramel, apples, citrus, brett, yeast, wood, spice, honey, vanilla. Slightly bitter finish. Medium bodied. Nice beer.

Pours a cloudy golden hue with a nice, frothy white head. Nose is fantastic. You get a whiff of the brandy, but also cider and the breadiness from the brett. Great balance on the flavor: apples, Belgian yeast, breadiness, and a bit of brandy that is really smoothed from the barrel aging. Great beer.

750ml bottle...cant believe I have to travel to Calgary to get this but such is life - at least I got to try it. That being said I didnt actually know what the expect and the lacto/tartness that was quite ripe completely threw me off - then I found out it had brett and things began to make sense. Amber with an off white head. Grains, brett, alcohol and apples (brandy), a cutting sweetness that I cant quite identify but similar to a chardonnay and oak. Combination of lacto, tart and sweetness on the palate - very unbalanced to begin with but once it had 30 minutes to breath things began to meld much better - carbonation was a bit high in my opinion, full bodied. Very very dry finish, some spice, tart and brandy. An interesting beer - not quite sure how I feel about it - would like to have another bottle to sit on fir a bit and see how it does with another 6 months.

Fruity, vanilla, brett and very sugary. I had this twice. The first time it was perfect, a great balance between vanilla, apple and alcohol in a very dry body. But the second time it was sugary and not dry. Still a very fine brew.  Ill have it again.

UPDATED: NOV 5, 2011 (*Cuvée 2011) Beaucoup dattente pour cette version vieillie de la Buteuse. Dès le départ, le liquide veut surgir de la bouteille et en la respirant, on comprend pourquoi. Le Brett sur un fond de brandy annonce une complexité presquabominable. Je prends une bonne respiration et je me lance...ouch! Lexcitation de savoir que jai 3 bouteilles dans le celliers sempare de moi. Tout le long la vanille ne sessouffle pas et appuie le touffu bouquet de saveur. Cest presque gras comme présence en bouche avec une finale poivrée, florale et juste assez funky. Une tonne de brandy boisé brule le fond de la gorge sans que je nai, une seconde, même pensé me plaindre.

A: The beer pours a hazy golden orange color with a big white head.

S: Theres a bit of booze that is detectable right away.  Oak, apple, and brandy aromas are quite pungent as are the floral and citrus notes.  A light funkiness, mostly cheesy, with a touch of vanilla and pear.

T: The cheese is still there on the palate.  The oak and apple brandy come through strongly, as do the vanilla and citrus peel notes.  Still very floral with a light booziness to go with the sweet malts.

M: Medium bodied with a rather high level of carbonation.

O: A really interesting beer.  A touch boozy (mostly on the nose), but nice overall.

November 13, 2010 - Waterloo tasting with blankboy, jerc, mabel and tupalev. My 750ml bottle.  Clear amber-tinged gold with a smallish creamy/fizzy off-white head.  Aroma of alcohol, tangy fruit - persimmon, nice and sour (good sour) - with oak (not bourbon, I guess its brandy) - somewhat vinous, but more white wine than red - 8+.  Taste is big oak with the tart fruit and brandy, but with dry nuttiness and a building wild yeast character, even champagne like - really, REALLY loved the dry nuttiness jutaposed against the barrel and Orval-y character, splendid stuff!  Frothy mouthfeel, just average-bodied, solid but soft carbonation (doesnt sting at all) - very light and airy, hides the alcohol very well, leaves a lightly acidic fruity and dry aftertaste - crazily easy to drink, I will grab another if I see one in Québec, hang the cost!!

Bottle shared by Shane, thanks! Poured a slightly hazy amber orange with a white head that dissipated to the edges. Aroma had a good amount of grain and bread with some cookie, caramel, brandy and a hint of light fruits in the finish. Flavor was similar but a bit sweeter with caramel throughout that melded nicely with the brandy and light fruit notes.

Bottle thanks to Arch. Pours cloudy orange. White head. Moderately quick dissipation. Nose and taste of Brett, bready malts, lemon, oak, yeast and light orange peel. Moderate tartness. Dryish finish. Medium body. Solid beer.

Thanks to flipper2gv for this.  750ml bottle.  Hazy copper in color with a one finger white head that leaves a thick foam. The aroma is very nice.  Floral and oaky with spice, vanilla, and fruitiness.  The flavor is pretty good and complex.  Sweet caramel malt, brandy, apple, peach, spices, and tobacco.  Medium-full bodied with a slightly syrupy mouthfeel and average carbonation.  Overall pretty good.  A well-crafted beer with a lot to it.
Clear golden color/ white head. Tropical fruit, vanilla, pale malt aromas. medium mouthfeel. Nice bready pale malt flavors with light fruit, cotton candy, warming twang to finish--
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: Bouteille 750 mL - Dégustée avec la Buteuse. Jy vais de mémoire... Arômes de Brett, dépices, de fruits, de vanille et dalcool. Goût dépices, de fruits, de Brett dans un corps vanillé avec une très agréable chaleur dalcool. Wow! Une excellente bière!

En bouteille, brassin de décembre 2010. Bière de belle apparence. Couleur tirant sur le dorée. Belle limpidité. Des arômes de fruits sont clairement perceptibles. Labricot, la pomme et le cidre de pommes transpersent larôme dépinette du houblon. Une note dépices est clairement présente. Je dirais le poivre. Le vieillissement en fut de chêne laissent de belles arômes et un bon goût. Les bulles font une belle remontée jusquau collet bien présent. En bouche, il y a une belle balance entre le petit goût sucré, lacidité et lamertume. Très bonne bière.

750 ml bottle purchased at Peluso (Montreal), in Febuary, 2011. Hazelnut blonde, medium head. Aroma of spicy malted barley, caramelized citrus notes. Taste of dry malted barley, notes of woody citrus and vanilla, dry sour aftertaste. An excellent beer, a true Quebec treasure!

Another Alex mystery beer, thanks dude! Bottle poured into a tulip...A great looking beer, then its down hill from there. A dark honey gold body that is coyly see through. A huge off white head that rises about four fingers, great retention and lacing... The aroma is very herbal, lemongrass, spice, really fresh orange zest, medicinal. Some components are individually nice, but together just doesnt work for me...As little as the aroma worked, taste was even less successful. Alex kept saying perfume and thats dead on. I felt like I was drinking an organic bottle of perfume, more medicine and spices, lest of the great orange zest. A hint of brett peaks through. Lemony brett throughout...Mouthfeel was very pleasant. I drank very little of this.

Another awesome tick but not something I would have again.

pours orange, tint of red, slight haze, with a thick rocky head, good retention. funky bretts here indeed. some apples, pears, mainly peach, vanilla, hint of sweetness, yeasty, woodsy, light citrus hops, warming alcohol, never boozy. average belgium yeast carbonation. full bodied. very good !
Light orangish color.  Nice head.  aroma is yeasty, brandy, oak, light spice, very light caramel notes.  Flavor is sweet, yeasty, light barrel note and some dry earthy notes.  NICE!

750 ml bottle.  Clearish pink orange with streaming bubbles and a snowy white cap.  Prettiest beer ive rated in a long time.  Nose is surprisingly soft with vanilla pudding, lemon danish and a dash of sweet brandy.  Coating and creamy with a zesty sparkle that becomes juicy then dry.  Taste also not what i expected.  Instead of a big boozy strong ale i find a delicately nuanced blond ale.  Honey, yeast, green apple, a touch of sage, cinnamon and oak.  Ending lightly tart with peach pit.  Wonderfully rustic yet sophisticated.

Bottled sample via Savvy1982, shared with oakbluff. Apricot in colour with medium carbonation. Quite floral on the nose, with notes of hop jelly, orchard fruit, wine barrel, and spice. Flavours are of smooth pale malts, round "spirit" notes, more barrel, sweet apple, faint savory cheese. Nice savory vs. lactic balance on the palate. Classy stuff. Id be interested to try it in another year to see what else the brett does to it.

Pours a clear copper hue with a prominent white head; nice retention and very effervescent.  Picking up some caramel notes in the aroma, mixed in with a light booziness and fresh wood undertone.  Full malt profile up front with a smooth woody sweetness which quickly recedes to a muted acidity and alcoholic bite.  Fairly lively on the palate, finishes with a pleasing warmth on the tongue.  I enjoyed this one.

Bottle [750ml] shared with HogTownHarry, tupalev, jerc & mabel -- c/o HogTownHarry. Pours a cloudy orange-amber with an average size semi-lasting white head. Nice semi-sweet and herbal aroma along with yeast, caramel malt & honey. Flavour is yeasty, sweet and lightly herbal along with caramel malt and honey. Alcohol is well hidden. Medium bodied. Great stuff!

Superbe couleur ambrée, belle mousse, sans être trop épaisse. Effluves de caramel brulé et de fruits. Au goût, légèrement acide, avec des notes épicées et de bois. Effervescence délicate mais très présente qui chatouille le palais. On déplorera son prix, à 20$ la bouteille là où nous lavous trouvé. Pour 5$ de moins, cest une bière de rêve, mais elle vaut tout de même le déplacement!

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2017 A long due update originally rated in 2011 this bottle was bought at flaveurs dici A: apples, light oak, alcohol app: clear cooper thick white lasting head and good lacing. T/p: med body with lightly acidic finish. Moderate carbonation.  O: To me, after all this year of existence this is still the best barrel aged beer made in Quebec. Its delicate yet complex and so interesting to drink. Amazing.

750mL bottle, pours hazy golden amber with a big white head. Aroma and flavour of yeast, brandy, oak, a little candied sugar, and dry fruits,
with a lingering yeasty, alcoholic finish.

Cette bière est fabuleuse, son goût est complexe, chaque gorgée est une découverte. Sa couleur orangée est très attirante, on dirait du bonbon liquide. Elle se boit bien, elle ne goûte pas trop lalcool. On goûte certains agrumes. Vraiment une bière à déguster et surtout à découvrir.
Le retour en arrière sera difficile, car Trou du diable met la barre haute!

750ml bottle from Firefly in Vancouver. Pours an orange gold, clear with a half inch of persistent off white head. Aroma has a spicy apple quality, mildly woody and sweet. Flavour is subtly sour apple, sharp cider crispness, mild spice, cereal malt with a tiny bit of roastedness. Some yeast. Finish is wonderfully long, dry and liqueur like. This beer really does come across as a hybrid between a well crafted English cider and a Belgian strong ale. Intriguing though shockingly expensive ($27).

Finally got to this thing. Too bad Im 2/3s the way into this bottle... banging to Static-X - Shadow Zone release. Poured out a hazy amber with an off white large foamy crown that gets knocked down to a ring. Smells like a fruitier version of Orval. Lots of citrus and some tropical fruits. Orange, lemon both on the sour side, bread crumbs, light funk and must. Apple pie apples without the spices. Pretty decent soft aroma that pleases the senses. Wonderful taste that keeps me coming back for more without being blown away at a single point. The fact that dudes in T.O. dolled out $46 bottle at Volo pretty much makes me sick - you guys got rick rolled! Just looking at the beard on that creep on the label should have made you think twice. 46$. Ouch. With all that said, this is still a very yumm-o brew. Brett, medium unassuming spices that creep into the secret places under your tongue that happify your taste buds. Now that Im paying attention (hard to think that after pounding most of this back without thought) there is a LOT going on here. Apples and sourness and then light funk and then a must that gets more funky then a loaf of bread passes by quickly then dulling spices and a long tart finish straightened me right the hell out. I just realized that this is 10%.... good bye tomorrows productivity.... again. The smell has changed to something spectacular. It took this long? Ill take it. Bump to 8 with ease. The spice and occasional thickness greeted me with open arms. Dammmit. Now I love this? ack. I was disappointed before. Mediocrity has morphed into acute interest. Then I hit a handful of sips that fade into the night without notice. Nice finish and feel with random spice punches, decent tartness throughout and the feeling that Im being watched.

Bottle, enormous thanks to Savvy1982. Pours orange with a large frothy beige head. Aroma of brett, nice and funky, various lighter fruits, citrus and citrus rind, cut grass, some mild apple and wood. For some reason I was expecting this to be boozy and strong, but the aroma is awesome and much lighter than I thought it would be. The taste has a lot of floral character along with funky yeast and a tiny bit of alcohol noticeable on the finish. This beer is extremely easy to drink for 10%. Its not too sweet, too woody, too boozy. This beer is truly excellent. The finish has some wood and herby bitterness and alcohol in the nose. The body is fairly light with medium high carbonation.

750ml bottle, amber-orange color, with a fluffy beige head, nice mild yeasty, earthy bretty, funky, wet oaky nose, with some mild sour green apple notes, with a hint of vinegar, spicy herbs, and with a faint musty accent in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a warmth alcohol phenolic, sweet toasted, caramel malt, yeasty, dusty, musty, earthy, bretty, funky, fruity, ripe apple, candied orange peel character with a good brandy liqueur, mild spicy vanilla, coriander flavours, and some honeyed sour green apple undertones, leading towards a strong warming, caramelized malt, brandy liqueurish, fruity candied citrus, sourness finish.

Sampled at Winter Warmer Montreal 2011. Hazy amber with a thin white head and average retention. Aroma is funky with wood, floral and herbal hops, hay, sugar and belgian malt. Flavor is Sugar, yeast, tart notes, herbal hops, fruity notes, wood and moderately bitter finish. Medium body.

Aroma is light gueuze notes mixed with malt. Has a nice foggy brown body with little head. Flavour is gueuze-like with a dry malt finish. The palate is dry; the body could be more solid, but Im nitpicking as this is good stuff.

This is quite similar to Orval, once you read the description its hard not to make comparisons. The barrel comes out in the nose and flavour, less so in the mouth. Its a slight bit smoother, but also slightly lacking palate, though its still great.

Le liquide présente une robe orangée et voilée.  Un petit anneau de mousse se dépose et saccroche.  Le nez se construit dans un habile enchevêtrement de parfums de pomme verte, de fruits tropicaux, de levure sauvageonne, de notes boisées, dalcool légèrement piquant, de fleurs sucrées et rugueuses qui se reposent dans un liquide doucement caramélisé.  Le goût est dominé par une levure forte qui combine quelques épices, des notes fruitées acidulés, des fleurs mordantes et des saveurs de sucre caramélisé touchées par un alcool fiévreux.  En bouche, le liquide a un corps moyen avec une effervescence justement nerveuse et une texture douce, voire même légèrement crémeuse.  En finale, la rencontre attendue de notes caressantes, de notes amères asséchantes et dalcool est avivée par la présence feutrée des brettanomyces.

Thanks bvc!  Bright gold, frothy wet white head.  Aggressive spicy triple aroma.  Nice doughy brett and green apple bretty goodness, great complexity, some white sugar, sweet brandy swirling throughout.

Nose is very interesting, tart green apples, brett, honey. Nice nose. Pours bright golden, great lasting head, some lace. Definitely tart, very fruity, pears, green apples, honey, barrel balances niicely. Lingering funky barrel. Nice beer here.

750ml capped bottle, thanks 10 Santa!  Pours a clear honey golden with tight slightly off white head.  Nose is delicate and subtile for the style.  Lightly sweet and bready, yeast is faint on the esters, dry, clean and dusty.  This is a triple that is to my liking but not to style per se.  Light in character and super drinkable, thanks Santa for this really awesome.

Aroma:Floral,oakfruity...
Appearance:Hazy orange,light head...
Flavor:Floral,oak-vanilla,,light citrus fruit....
Bottle (Thx travlr!). Pours hazy orange with an off-white head. Flavor is lemony, yeast, sweet fruits, brandy, light hops. Finishes tart and smooth. Very good.

Bottle at Volo 750 ml 
Aroma funky front with hint of citrus , hop and feel of Belgian yeast followed by green grape. Quiet interesting and different. 8-
 Appearance  lightly hazed amber with medium creamy fizzy top.3+
Flavor and Palate : Frisky front with light tartness followed by amber malts and alcohol. Hint of clove and other spices. Interesting to see mineral like character. Tart fruity top.

Bottle, shared with dave. Light hazy orange, low head. Slightly sour, fruity aroma, weakly phenolic. Flavours of cooked apples, cooked peaches, soft spices, light wood. Finish has a light tartness early on, but this wears away for me, and the phenols come forward more. Interesting brew.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text:
[3472-20101113] Bottle. Light fruity sour yeast aroma has light cherry notes. Clear, medium orange body with a long-lasting creamy off-white head. Fruity yeast flavour has a long bitter aftertaste. Medium body. Interesting enough.
(c/o HogTownHarry, w/ him, blankboy, jerc, tupalev)

750 ml bottle from trade with Savy1982. Thanks Kyle. Pours a hazy copper color with a big sudsy white head that has good retention and ample lacing. The aroma is funky with sour apples, wine and cider vinegar. The flavor is sour with sour green apples, cider and yeast. The palate is full and smooth with prickly carbonation. Finishes long and sour. Overall: Sour, but not overly so, a very tasty brew.

2010-11-13. Cris amber body with a large foamy off-white head. 3+ Mild aroma at first, modest fruity character has a tangy sour twinge to it, interesting fruit notes have a plum like character. 7+ Flavour is surprisingly well balanced, warming alcohol grows as it goes, dry sugary pale malt, light kiss of wood. Mild tangy fruit and alcohol linger long into the finish. 7+ Sweet middle finishes fairly dry. Smooth average plus bodied palate. Nice. I suspect your response to this might vary wildly on your mood. Bottle shared by HogTownHarry

UPDATED: DEC 27, 2013 $46 bottle plus t&t at Bar Volo, shared with Jason. Funky aroma, cuvee aromas. Hazy golden with a generus soapy head. Very lacey. ABove average mouthfeel. A little sweetness from the brett, otherwise various fruits from rich apple through apricot.You can almost taste some fruit skin. The alcohol is well hidden. Better as it warms, and starts to grow on you. Very unusual barreling, glad I had the Captain lawrence apple brandy barreling as well. Just as good 3 years later, the brett giving it sour/wild finish..
Orangy color with thin lacing head.  Nose is is hoppy, citrus, sweet. Taste is strong apple, cider, citrus. A little too east to drink based on alcohol content! Really nice.

Pours hazy amber with an excellent thick white head. Aroma is strong, brett and stone fruits dominate the nose. There are also strong notes of oak and brandy. Flavour is amazing bold and oaky with lots of sourness, strawberry brandy. It is bright and spicy with a long lingering finish. This is an amazing Beer. I love it! Perfect Balance this is an amazing and complex brew!

750ml bottle shared by jsprime. thx for the share jeff! pours hazed amber with a lasting white head. big barnyard brett aroma with aged pale malt and apply booze. flavour of apple brandy, pale malt structure, minimal funk. the body was pretty lean and the finish was modestly dry for a beer of this weight. pretty stunning beverage. i wish i could have tried it atmultiple ages but thatd be pretty hard to do with a 400 bottle release. thanks again jeff.

750ml--> I had more funkyness in mind. Apple brandy all the way. Very complex beer with a slight spicy nose. After 30 minutes, the beer took a brown sugar-nutmeg turn. Flirting with the christmas beer tradition. The good news is, it was the first of the 12 bottles I both. Trou du Diable sould be in the top 20 best brewery in the world.

UPDATED: MAY 10, 2012 750ml bottle. Hazy orange/amber pour with a quickly dissipating head. Smells a lot like a good aged cider with lots of oak. Exotic fruit and apple on the palate with some funk and a tart booziness.
BCTC 2010, Ratebeer tent, rudolf,s bottle i believe. light aroma. sweet flavor, some spritziness, medium oak, light tart & sour aspects, orange/apple citrus. ok

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2010 Huge thanks to sflpunk for this one. Pours a murky amber with a frothy, off-white head that perks up nicely with a little swirl. On first sniff, this is clearly fermented with Brett- clear sour notes of barnyard, acidic lemon, and funk that really dominate the front of the nose. As I continue to delve into the aroma, the funk falls away, leaving a foundation built from notes of green apple, cider, plum, orange liqueur like Grand Marnier, some doughy yeast, booze, and touches of sage-- incredibly complex and impressive. Flavor is luscious, with charred wood and a wetter manifestation of Brett like musty hay. The hop, brandy alcohol, and fruit seems to build as the flavor progresses. Mouthfeel is full bodied, with characteristics from both the sour brett and sweet and boozy Belgian notes creating an amazingly diverse but symbiotic palate. This is a fantastic beer, and to me, because of this beer Dieu du Ciel no longer monopolizes the top 5 beers from Canada.

Bottle shared by jbye4334 at winter tasting.  Color of copper with a small frothy head.  Aroma is a sour hay scent.  Medium bodied with light Brett flavors and a Belgian yeast fruit flavor.  Overall its a very nice brew.

Shared with savvy1982. Pours a glowing orange with yellow highlights. Massive white head that laces beautifully. The aroma is dry, musty, funky and fruity. Green apples, dried leaves, herbal hops, grass, brett and oak on the nose. The flavor is quite complex. Berries, pineapple, apples, dry leaf, honey, pears, oak, clove, grass, musty basement, plum skin and a nice bitter-sweet lingering finish. Lively palate. Brilliant beer!

Bottle, thanks to Poperinge! Pours clear amber, with a medium off-white head, great lacing! Nose is apples, yeast, brett, oak, vanilla, toast. Flavors are oak, brandy, green apple, Gds, there is so much here... Very bold and exceptionally balanced. Delicious!

Very good yellowish head over hazy orange beer. Powerful nose of wild fruity, fruitacids and -esters, Brettanomyces and lactic acid. Orangezeste aroma, saddlesoap. All the above in the taste, with an extra emphasis on spicy-bitterish, typically Brett flavours, moulded orange. Dry, medium bodied, quite carbonated MF; long fruity aftertaste gaining a perfumed rosewater-like flavour. Very special beer; IMO more like a (Belgian) sour ale than a Strong Belgian.  Un grand merci à Dany!!

If you see it jump on it...Juste à la voir on sait quon va vivre une expérience.  Déjà au nez on est submergés darômes.   Lorsque on lui goute cest fait,  la multitudes de gouts prends par surprise et cest le WOW  qui lemporte.

Bottle: Poured a clear amber color ale with a large foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of Brett is dominant with some balanced sweet malt also noticeable with light fruity ester. Taste is also a quite complex mix between some funky ester with dominant barnyard notes and a typical Belgium tripel malt base with balanced sweetness. Body is above average with good carbonation and no apparent alcohol. Very well done though I was expecting a more pronounced taste from the cider barrel aging process.

UPDATED: MAR 26, 2010 I believe Vintage 2010 bottle;  17,99$ for a single bottle of this 7-wonders-of-Québecs-beer kind.  Striking alchoolic aroma propelled by a medium carbonation numbs in the second and leads to an insane craving for more (it is a tragedy to my selfishness that my girlfriend liked it and asked me for a glass of it...).  Very complex (Viper666 probably only told only about 1% percent...).  Dry finish.  Boozy.  Majestic.  Wow!  I could go on...
Big thanks to nimbleprop for this ... bottle at home ... hazy amber .... thin off white head ... funky very fruity nose ... yeasty fruity light soft melow hop ...

750ml bottle at the DC local tasting.  Pours a caramel amber with a frothy white head.  Aroma is all apples, almost cider-like, a little caramel, almost like apple cobbler, perhaps a little brett.  Flavor is sweet, bone sticking caramel, apples, butterscotch.  SUPER dry finish.  Loved this.

UPDATED: MAR 28, 2017 Bottle 750ml. @ cgarvieuk - Cigar City tasting. [ As Le Trou du Diable Buteuse Brassin Spécial (Brandy Oak) ].Unclear medium amber orange color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted, caramel, moderate yeasty, overripped fruit, orange - exotic fruit, apple notes, belgium yeast, light alcohol. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20100206]
 7-3-8-3-15 
Draught @ Moeder Lambic Original, 68 rue de Savoie, Brussels, Belgium 1060. [ As Le Trou du Diable Buteuse Brassin Spécial (Brandy Oak) ].Unclear medium orange color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, moderate hoppy, citrus, grass, fruity hops, moderate yeasty, fruity yeast, apple notes. Flavor is moderate sweet, light acidic and moderate bitter with a long duration, tart, hoppy, fruity yeast, brett - funky - leather, apple notes, alcohol. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20160917]
 7-3-8-3-15

750ml bottle, thanks ryan.  Off-white head atop amber body.  Aroma is moderately sweet, straw, some yeast, Brett, light Brandy.  Taste is moderately sweet Brandy, straw, wood/brett.  Medium body, alcohol well contained.

Bit of apple in the nose, some smoky brett, bit of pear and just a tad of herbal hops. Flavor is initially sweet, with apple, pear and honey, but soon after is followed by lots of oakey tannins, light funk and tartness. Medium body is moderately carbonated with a tannic, bitter finish. Not that bad.

Light amber.  Lively.  Slight hazy but limited head.  The aroma is complex - brett forward with barrel nuances (fruit) and accents of the underlying tripel (florals, phenols, continental hops).  The phenols can be a bit aggressive.  A bit hot, and with a bit much paint thinner.  Good dryness, though, with hints of brett and woody accents.  Nice fruit.  Not as rounded as Id like it to be, but a decent brew.

28-02-2010. Amber/red. Pours a medium head, medium cabonation. Aroma is Brett. cherry, fruity, caramel. Taste is spicy, THe brett are definitly there,  fruity as well. Very different from what we are used to. Very goog.

Bottle shared by Presario. Warm amber, a very nice bright color with a scant head. Slight pedio is manageable in the aroma. Perfume and saison character with plenty of spice, egg shells, persimmon, and pomelo--not quite citrus. Great palate with good quaffability. Solid carbonation. Citrusy hop flavors are excellent, reminiscent of a Belgian-style IPA. Persimmon again, and pomelo pitch. Astringent with nice lingering persimmon on the tongue, dry, gets better with every sip.

Bret is notable in the aroma but the fruity yeast esters are still apparent along with some alcohol.  Peppery, cinnamon, nutmeg are all apparent as well.  Clear deep golden colour is topped by a low but lasting white head.  Flavour offers browned apples, spice, pepper, nutmeg, calvados, alcohol and some marzipan.  Brandy is especially notable on the aftertaste.  Strong alcohol warming.  Thick rich and creamy with wonderful carbonation that dances on the tongue.  Delicious!  Tulip glass.  Cellar temperature.Bottle (Batch 2) savoured at the Olympic tasting session.
Bottle, courtesy of Greg at Churchkey.  Orange with an edge head and moderate lacing.  Aroma of apples and oak.  Flavor has apples, pine, malt.  Good balance.  Nice one.
Bottle @ cgarvieuk. Clear golden colour, off-white head. Aroma of yeast and fruits. Flavour is yeasty, bitter and hoppy with some sweetness. Fruity. Highly carbonated. Sour finish.

UPDATED: DEC 17, 2010 750mL thanks to Greg at Churchkey DC. Pours a hazy light yellow with a thin white head. Aroma is light Brett, big cedar, driftwood, green apples. Initial taste is like Flintstone chewable vitamins. Very mineral-like with some metallic notes as well. Big white wine character. Dry and light tartness. Very interesting and fun to savor. 7/3/8/4/15=3.7 2/11/2010
750mL courtesy of Travlr. Poured a slightly hazy amber with a decent white head with okay retention and not much lace. Aroma is very nice: sharp Brett, cedar, Bretty earth, slight red wine reduction, red wine vinegar, herbs and butter, fatty steak. Really an unbelievably good nose. Taste is ultra rich cinnamon malt, toffee, caramel, rich sweet malt, slight spicy alcohol, light Brett presence. Oily, rich palate. 9/3/8/4/15=3.9 12/16/2010

Bottle This beer rocks!... Clear golden ale with a mid-sized, creamy, white head. Excellent retention. Woody, acidic, fruity nose  apricot. Medium to full-bodied with stinging carbonation. Honey and toffee malt sweetness melds nicely with interesting acidity and funkiness. Sweet/tart finish that dries out entirely. Thanks go out to Beerlando for sharing this world class beer!

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2013 Bouteille de 750ml vendue plus chère que bien des bouteilles de vins. Belle mousse épaisse et blanche. Couleur orangée. Nez avec touche dalcool, épinette. Bouche piquante, alcool, boisée, finale chaude. Quelque chose accroche. 6/10

750ml bottle.  The body is clear, showing an orange-gold amber hue.  A small, foamy, ivory colored head breaks apart at the middle, forming a smooth, fat ring around the edge of the surface.  Sudsy lacing primarily rejoins the body below.  Scents of rightfully oxidized, residual candy sugar malts and dried red apples provide an earthy, subdued sweetness, while hints of tart fruit merge with woody brett and vanilla barrel notes to form the aromatic counterpoint.   Flavors mirror the nose, striking complimentary balance between the tempered sweetness of the dried out caramel and candied apples, and the musky, bretty, vanilla kissed oak.  The body sports a wild, dusty, drying body that is medium-plus in substance, with a soft, persistent carbonation.  This is an excellent "wild" Belgian strong ale.  Id love to try the base beer for contrast, just to see how buggy the barrel aging process was.

(bottle shared at RSRIZZOs winter gathering on 1/10/10; bottle from a trade w/ Presario). Cloudy dark copper color. Large off white head, which is mostly diminishing. Yeasty, earthy aroma, with light oak. Strong earthy flavor with light oak. Avg duration. Smooth finish. Slick texture. Moderate/fizzy carbonation. Spare lacing.

Bottle shared at RSRIZZOs winter gathering (provided by jbye4334).  Pours lightly hazy orange with a fizzy and bubbly white head, somewhat lasting with fair lacing.  Aroma is farmhouse, barnyard, straw, hay, and dank yeast, floral, earthy, and cheesy hops, oak, horse blanket, malt, peach, and pear.
